Posts.Content: I found the waiting the hardest part as you seem to be treading water. I went to my doctors in August last year and eventually started chemo in February, so a very long journey for me. But cannot fault the treatment I received as I had mammograms core biopsies, CT scans, bone scans etc at least I had a full M.O.T. But   found the waiting between appointments agonising and my imagination was working overtime.At least now I know were I am going. Good luck on your journey you are not alone. wendyx
Posts.Title: waiting and more waiting :(

Posts.Content: When I went on line yesterday I looked up the memberships and only got partially through the "A"s this thing is worldwide and I realised I am not the only one out there going through this. I don't wish this disease  on anyone but to know I have all this supprt certainly helps me . So thankyou all out there for the love and understanding. I have a very loving family that are extreemly supportive but I know they are worrying about me and don't want to off load my thoughts to them. It helps to talk . Again thankyou.
Posts.Title: You are not alone

Posts.Content: My darling you brightened up a vey dull and wet day, your poor old pussy cat I bet he wondered what he had done wrong to be treated like that. Laughter is a wonderful tool ( If I can call it that) it brings you from the edge of despair, wrinkles your nose and give you that feel good feeling. So long may it continue. Thank you for sharing it with us. Bless you Wendyxx
Posts.Title: messag for Rbee1

Posts.Content: Thinking of you today I hope all goes well sweetheart. I had a picc line put in 2 weeks ago, at the time the nurse said my procedure was very challenging? trust me to be awkward.I was at the hospital 4 hours in total but I have not found it intrusive in any way.I know it is frightening when you read all the side effects but many others have gone before us and we are in safe hands.lots of love coming your way Wendyx
Posts.Title: Hi Clarey Fairy

Posts.Content: Lady Pepys its messages like yours that give us all inspiration, this is a very difficult journey but you give us the will to carry on. So glad you have come through and are enjoying life again.make every day worth while. lots of lovexxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: There's light at the end of the tunnel, ladies...

Posts.Content: Hi lady Pepy, I am sure you have inspired so many people to reach their goal. THANKYOU. I am a very positive person and have no doubt that I will come through this phaze in my life although the gremlins creep in occasionally. I hope your hip operation is successful and you will be mobile again soon.I am a keep fit freak and love exercise so can understand how you wamt to get back up and going. Goodluck on a speedy recovery. Back on the wacky backie (chemo) today.lots of love and good wishes coming your way. Wendyxx
Posts.Title: There's light at the end of the tunnel, ladies...

Posts.Content: Hi Maryon I'm going to  ask about the gel when I go in next week, thank you for the inf. I also found in the night and have no saliva so I suck a wine gum to help me salivate, just don't fall asleep if you try this. Thanks Wendyx
Posts.Title: help with mouth dryness

Posts.Content: Blue Book? I wasn't given one, so I will ask next week when I go in. It's a very long time since I was pregnant so don't remember the whys and wherefors of what I could eat way back then. Thankyou for your help Julia it's very much appreciated. Isn't funny when you know you can't eat certain things you crave them?Wendyx
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?

Posts.Content: At 75 years old I know I am not pregnant ?? but because there are some things you are advised  not to consume I have a craving for a MacDonalds ice cold milk shake and a wedge of cheese cake both of which I rarely eat, but because they may be a NO GO I fancy them. Any advice gratefully accepted, Thankyou Wendyxx
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?

Posts.Content: A BIG thankyou to all who replied about McDonalds milk shake it's not that I am going overboard but I know a little of what you fancy does you good, And it's sods law that if I can't have it I will want it. So my cancer buddie a friend of over 20 years and I are going for one after our picc line cleans on Monday so cheers everyone. and again THANKYOU for your help. Wendyx p.s. I have printed off the info that you sent me Dreamthief
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?

Posts.Content: Thank for the speedy replyJulia it is uncanny as Last year I lost 3 1/2 stone on The Sun Diet and wonder if I would have found my lodger (cancer) if I hadn't done so. My daughters have scaulded me and told me not to diet again until I have come through this period in my life. But like you I have been comfort eating and slowly the pounds are piling on again.I do try to keep control of things and then I go awol, and think what's  the hell life is too short, but I like being slim again and fit and healthyand this will help us in our recovery. I don't think an odd treat will hurt us so enjoy what ever you fancy we have lost weight before so we can do it again when we get over the other side of the hilllots of love and good wishes Wendyxx ALL I CAN SAY IS THANK GOD I FOUND THIS SITE AS IT IS AMAZING Wendyx
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?

Posts.Content: of course you are worried , you have been through a lot recently and this is a whole new ball game. I think if we are honest we are all paranoid about anything unknown. Having bc has certainly opened my eyes. I don't think enough information is given to the public on this subject, I always thought bc was like a pimple on your skin; mine was deep inside and felt more like a muscle.
Posts.Title: bloody insensitive doctors !!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Silvercloud where I live in the midlands I was offered a lovely wig to combat my hair loss.   I was grey so I opted for a colour called salt and pepper and a short style, I even took mine to my hair dressers for her to trim and style it to my old hairstyle so I am very happy now , it so comfortable that  forget I have it on. I hope you can find something to suit you;.my young grand children have accepted my new hair style and it isn't such a shock for them. The Macmillan ladies  attached to my hospital were very helpful and will give you advise. Hope this information is helpful to you. Good luck on your journey lots of love Wendyx
Posts.Title: Oncologist appointment questions to ask

Posts.Content: I am amazed just how many of my friends and people I know that have told me they have had cancer too. It seems peolpe don't talk about as if they are ashamed. It isn't our fault that we have this disease it is just the luck of the draw.I found out yesterday that an old school friend had it 30 years ago and she never told anyone only close family. I think being open about it and accepting it is part and parcel of the treatment. You cannot pretend it is going to go away by magic or brush it under the carpet.We mus be positive and look forward to our future.KEEP SMILING you are not alone
Posts.Title: How many do you know?

Posts.Content: Hello my buddies, I have just read all the threads totally agree with you about how amazing this support group is.. Because we all understand the issues and where we are coming from.I too have my 3rd FEC on the 23rd so getting a dab hand at it, I reassured a young girl on my last session as she was frightened.and recommended she joined the support group on line.My only real down side is an ulcerated mouth and insomnia.,but I'm ready for my next assault, medication at the ready.Love the weather at the moment getting out as much as possible. Everyone seems to be going away for Easter but I am staying put, there will be plenty of ti.me to go raoming when this phase in my life is over, I will definately make up for lost time then. Hope everything goes well for you all on the next chemo session.Wendyx
Posts.Title: Hi islapops and slou

Posts.Content: If anything good has come out of me getting cancer it is the rekindling of old friendships.Lifelong friends that I write to inside a Christmas card once a year, have offered me help and renewed contact with them. So I have been catching up on all the news. It's sad how we lose contact, we don't fall out but just go our separate ways and drift apart. I like to think that we go through life helping each other and what we sow is what we reap, I know mine has come back threefold but sadly I had to have cancer to realise how precious these friendships are. So hang on to your friends you never know when you may need them. They could well be your lifeline. Wendyx
Posts.Title: Aren't friends wonderful?

Posts.Content: Like you fiddlesticks I have  found neighbours knocking my door and offering help,even friends of friends asking if they can do anything it has certainly renewed my faith in mankind one person ;when I said I was not a pretty sight as I had lost my hair told me beauty cmes from inside and that i was beautifu.What a lovely thing to say made me almost cry. Wendyx
Posts.Title: Aren't friends wonderful?
